meanings.definition: An image that is greatly reduced in size for detailed examination.
meanings.sent1: Scientists used a powerful microscope to study the microimage of the cell.
meanings.sent2: The detective zoomed in on the microimage of the fingerprint for clues.
meanings.sent3: The microimage of the ant under the magnifying glass looked like a giant monster.
meanings.sent4: The microimage of the leaf revealed intricate details invisible to the naked eye.
meanings.sent5: Examining the microimage of the fabric helped identify its unique pattern.
